Award.AwardTitle: Scripps Classroom Connection: Developing a School District/Research Institution Partnership in Earth System Science Education

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
Scripps Classroom Connection: Developing a School District/Research Institution Partnership In Earth System Science Education

The Scripps Classroom Connection (SCC) aims to systemically and simultaneously improve communication skills of Earth Science (ES) graduate students and K-12 ES education at the San Diego Unified School District (SDUSD). These goals are relevant because earth science literacy (ESL) is fundamental to the success of our society, which must practice much more effective stewardship of our very fragile planet. Society needs to understand how planet Earth works as an integrated chemical, physical and biological system to develop appropriate strategies for sustainable use of earth resources, disposal of waste products, effective mitigation of the impact of climate change, and natural disasters. Yet ES is amongst the most neglected STEM education disciplines.

The SCC is based on a close collaboration between Scripps Institution of Oceanography, a world-class research institute in Earth and ocean science, and the SDUSD, the 8th largest urban school district in the US, with the guidance of professionals from the UCSD education science department. Key efforts and outcomes of our project will include: (1) Development of an enduring, pedagogically robust curriculum in ES at the SDUSD through a collaboration between scientists, teacher-educators, teachers and graduate students; (2) Training of a new breed of graduate students that is equally comfortable communicating their science to their specialist peers and to lay audiences, (3) Effectively raising ESL in SDUSD schools laying a foundation for a public that becomes an effective steward of Planet Earth.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Scripps Institution of Oceanography’s (Scripps) Graduate Teaching Fellows in K-12 Education program, the Scripps Classroom Connection (SCC), was focused on advancing both graduate and secondary school Earth science education by teaching communication skills to graduate fellows while bringing up-to-date Earth science discoveries and content expertise to secondary school classrooms. The SCC involved a close collaboration between Scripps, a world class research institution in Earth and ocean science, and the San Diego Unified School District (SDUSD), the 8th – largest urban US school district.

 

A total of 42 SCC GK-12 fellows (3 participated for 2 years) formed 1:1 partnerships with teachers over the five-years of the program. The teacher-fellow teams produced a range of laboratory and classroom activities in collaboration with their Scripps faculty advisors that were tested in classrooms using robust pedagogical approaches.  All activities developed as part of SCC have been documented as digital library objects, and reviewed and published as a robust archive that serves as the foundation for future work in K-12 ES education.

 

The SCC has had a broad and lasting impact:  (1) It has impacted the way ES is taught in the 2nd largest school district in California (more than 135,000 students). (2) Scripps graduate students are carrying their communication skills and expectations for graduate student professional development into their own professional future, often in leading positions and in high-level academic institutions. (3) Bringing together the expertise of a world-class Earth and ocean science institution and the second-largest school district in California has lead to a sustained relationship between Scripps and SDUSD, which is being realized in ongoing community outreach involving well-trained (in science communications and teaching) graduate students and Scripps participation in the roll out of Next Generation Science Standards district-wide.
